messages.text: Don't mind the GH notifications about pushes and builds failing. I'm trying to update franklin and the org website repo to build successfully, but it's not going as smoothly as I'd like.

elements.text: Don't mind the GH notifications about pushes and builds failing. I'm trying to update franklin and the org website repo to build successfully, but it's not going as smoothly as I'd like.

messages.text: m*********** it worked! We should be good now. Timothee's update to the pubs page are live now.

messages.text: Hi everyone!, just in case anyone is interested, I have adapted to Turing the Stan code used by <https://besjournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1111/2041-210X.12587|Rota et al>. to model multi-species co-occurrence at different sites. Is there anyone working on species occupancy and things like that? <https://github.com/jmrmcode/Multispecies-Occupancy-model-using-Turing>

messages.text:
Hi Ecology. Working through ported  projects like StatisticalRethinking.jl has been a really great way to build familiarity in julia, especially with probabilistic programming.

Bayesian Population Analysis (kery / schaub) has been ported in Stan, has anyone come across efforts to port BPA in Julia/turing?

elements.text:
Hi Ecology. Working through ported  projects like StatisticalRethinking.jl has been a really great way to build familiarity in julia, especially with probabilistic programming.

Bayesian Population Analysis (kery / schaub) has been ported in Stan, has anyone come across efforts to port BPA in Julia/turing?

messages.text: I'm not familiar with it (which doesn't mean a whole lot), but you can ask around in <#C6821M4KE|statistics> too.
